intro: Rhaponticoides hierroi, commonly known as the African mountain spinach, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of spoon-shaped, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Rhaponticoides hierroi is valued for its edible leaves, which are used in local cuisine and traditional medicine.
